subject: RE: [junit] JUnit 4.0 release candidate 2 Test.None
msgSnippet: Another way to say this is that we needed a Null Object to represent the case where there is no expected exception and you can t use null as a default value.
messageBody:
Another way to say this is that we needed a Null Object to represent the case where there is no expected exception and you can't use null as a default value. Test.None is package scope, so it shouldn't be publicly accessible, or am I missing something?

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Elliotte Harold
> Sent: Thursday, January 19, 2006 7:19 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4.0 release candidate 2 Test.None
>
> David Saff wrote:
>
> > None is the default value of the expected attribute on the Test
> > annotation. It is not intended for outside use. Thanks,
>
> Can this be made non-public then?
>
